result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J. Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Shall pay fine + costs within 60 days or set payment plan with Clerk of Courts;
Failure to Pay = 11 days DCJ w/h&t

Shall serve 30 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 7/24/15 by 6:00 pm
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
11:28. Defendant, Michael J. Hintz, in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Attorney Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews PQ/WOR, pnlts + chrgs, agreement.  Deft enters NC plea to Ct.2 .  Court finds plea made f/v/ki, factual basis exists, accepts plea and finds Deft guilty of Ct. 2 and D-RI Ct. 1.  Atty Thompson heard.  Atty Shelton heard.  Statement by Deft.  Thomas J Hintz takes stand, sworn --gives statment.  Excused. Court heard and ORDERS:

30 days in the DCJ w/ h+t commencing 7/24/15 by 6:00 p.m.
$100 + cc --ftp is 11 days in the DCJ
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2015 at 11:30 am.
Defendant Michael J. Hintz in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Shelton requests JT remain; no further scheduling; bond cont.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with SJM.   Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.

9:27 - Defendant Michael J. Hintz in court with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. RD & JT set. Court sets $500 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim.  Return date scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
